summary: The Invest to Protect Act of 2025 establishes a grant program within the Office of Community Oriented Policing Services to support local law enforcement. The program aims to provide training, access to mental health resources, and improve recruitment and retention. Grants can fund de-escalation training, victim-centered training, evidence-based safety training, bonuses, stipends for education, behavioral health services, and data collection. The bill includes reporting requirements, a streamlined application process, audit requirements, and measures to prevent duplicative grants with an authorization of $50 million per fiscal year from 2027 to 2031
